title: Consumer Cos Down After Weak Jobs Data — Consumer Roundup
text:
Shares of retailers and other consumer-services companies fell after weak jobs data.

Job postings fell 3% from a year earlier in July to 7.217 million after declining 2% in June, the Labor Department reported, hinting that the boom in job creation is levelling off.

Some airlines rose as traders bought up economically sensitive transportation stocks.

Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 10, 2019 17:15 ET (21:15 GMT)
